channel.title: VPS Portforwarding
channel.description: can someone teamviewer me and help me set the ports for my VPS. i have been looking and looking and all godaddy can tell me is that the ports are inside the Windows Firewall can anyone help me out plz

item.title: VPS Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Forsakinpkers:

can someone teamviewer me and help me set the ports for my VPS. i have been looking and looking and all godaddy can tell me is that the ports are inside the Windows Firewall can anyone help me out plz

VPS’s should, in theory, be set up with all ports open. If not, your vendor can set it up in a matter of minutes. It’s free of charge for them to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @rossy319 rossy319
item.description:
@rossy319 wrote:

I’d be happy to pm me if you want

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

With a VPS you have a dedicated IP Address, which means no purpose for port-forwarding. However, you have to change the windows firewall settings on your VPS and have it allow port 43594, 5555, or whatever your private server is using.

Read full topic
